units.title: Cortical organoid seeding density
units.text: Cells were reconstituted in neural induction medium at a density of 10,000 cells per well in 200 μl well in 96-well v-bottom low-adhesion plates.
units.rationale: Specifies the cell density and plate format for initiating organoid cultures.

units.title: Nucleus isolation from fresh tissue (lysis and pelleting)
units.text: Lysed cells were then washed with 1 ml chilled wash buffer (10 mM Tris-HCl pH 7.4, 10 mM NaCl, 3 mM MgCl2, 0.1% Tween-20, 1% BSA) and nuclei were pelleted at 500g for 5 min at 4 °C.
units.rationale: Describes the buffer composition and centrifugation step to isolate nuclei.

units.title: Single‑cell RNA‑seq library generation
units.text: Single-cell RNA-seq libraries were generated using the 10X Genomics Chromium 3′ Gene Expression Kit. In brief, single cells were loaded onto chromium chips with a capture target of 10,000 cells per sample.
units.rationale: Outlines the platform and target cell number for scRNA‑seq library construction.

units.title: Bulk ATAC‑seq library preparation
units.text: Bulk ATAC-seq libraries were generated as described57. In brief, 50,000 nuclei were permeablized and tagmented. Tagmented chromatin libraries were generated and sequenced on an Illumina NovaSeq with a target sequencing depth of 50 million reads per library.
units.rationale: Provides the key steps and sequencing depth for bulk ATAC‑seq.

units.title: H3K27ac CUT&Tag primary antibody incubation
units.text: Primary antibody (Cell Signaling 8173), and incubated overnight at 4 °C on an overhead rotary shaker rotating at 90 rpm, and changed to Dulbecco’s modified Eagle’s medium (DMEM)/F12-based medium containing 1× glutamax, 1× N2, 1× B27 with vitamin A and 1× anti-anti.
units.rationale: Details the incubation conditions for the primary antibody in CUT&Tag.

units.title: Nucleus isolation from frozen tissue
units.text: Frozen tissue samples were thawed in 2 ml chilled homogenization buffer (10 mM Tris pH 7.8, 5 mM CaCl2, 3 mM magnesium acetate, 320 mM sucrose, 0.1 mM EDTA, 0.1% NP40, 167 μM β-mercaptoethanol, 16.7 μM PMSF) and lysed in a pre‑chilled dounce. Cell lysates were then centrifuged in an iodixanol gradient for 20 min at 3,000g at 4 °C in a swinging bucket centrifuge with the brake turned off. The nucleus band was then carefully pipetted.
units.rationale: Specifies thawing, lysis, and gradient centrifugation to recover nuclei from frozen tissue.

units.title: scATAC‑seq library preparation
units.text: scATAC‑seq libraries were prepared for sequencing following the 10X Genomics single‑cell ATAC‑seq solution protocol (v1.0 kit was used). Nuclei were loaded with a capture target of 10,000 nuclei per sample.
units.rationale: Defines the platform and target nuclei number for scATAC‑seq library creation.

units.title: Library PCR amplification conditions
units.text: Libraries were amplified with the cycling conditions: 72 °C for 5 min; 98 °C for 30 s; 12 cycles of 98 °C for 10 s and 63 °C for 30 s; final extension at 72 °C for 1 min and hold at 4 °C.
units.rationale: Lists the precise thermal cycling program for library enrichment.

units.title: DNA purification with AMPure XP beads
units.text: Libraries were purified with a 1:1 ratio of AMPure XP beads and eluted in 15 μl EB.
units.rationale: Describes the bead‑to‑sample ratio and elution volume for DNA cleanup.

units.title: Cell‑type labeling with CellWalker
units.text: To identify cell types at a higher resolution, we assigned cell‑type labels using the CellWalker17 method, as implemented in CellWalkR (v0.1.7).
units.rationale: Specifies the computational tool used for refined cell‑type annotation.
